description: Erection of single storey rear extension (6.0m in depth, maximum height of 3.40m and eaves height of 3.00m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extension would join the existing outbuilding (garage) and result in the total enlargement extending beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and having a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (ja) and (j) (iii) of the of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The proposed extension would join the existing outbuilding (garage) and the enlarged part of the dwellinghouse would therefore extend beyond the rear wall of the original dwellinghouse by more than 6 metres in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (g)(i) of the of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

This application seeks a non-material amendment to planning permission ref. 17/14632/FUL. The applicant wishes to make some internal changes to the floor layout of the permitted residential units but would not change the quantum or mix of units. In addition some changes to the approved fenestartion and balconies are proposed. Officers consider the proposed arrangement to be accceptable and a non material amendment and as such, it is recommended that the application be granted.It is noted that one objection has been received. The objection is summarised as follows. - Car park issues- Excessive height or bulk of buildings- Inappropriate design/layout- Loss of light/Sunlight- PrivacyOfficer comment: The proposal does not result in a material change to the extant permission 17/14632/FUL. The proposed changes would not change the quantum of units or their mix and would not alter the extant relationship with the neighbouring properties with regards the height and bulk, provision of daylight/sunlight or privacy and would not increase demand for parking.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Condition 15 (Sustainable Drainage Strategy) of Planning Permission 18/10177/FUL have been assessed by The Local Lead Flood Authority, are satisfactory and are hereby fully approved.

Please provide existing and proposed floor plans at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.The submitted floor plans do not have a scale bar.

Please provide copies of all existing and proposed elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work.The submitted proposed elevations do not have a scale bar.
